content.name: వ్యక్తిగత మరియు సంస్థాగత విలువలు
content.description: ఉద్యోగులకు వారి ఉద్యోగ జీవితాన్ని సులభతరం మరియు సంతృప్తికరం చేసుకోవడానికి, సంస్థాగతమైన మరియు వ్యక్తిగతమైన విలువలకు మధ్య పొందిక ఉండేలా ఉద్యోగ స్థలం వద్ద ఒత్తిడిని తగ్గించుకోవడం ముఖ్యమైన సంగతి. సంస్థాగతమైన మరియు వ్యక్తిగతమైన విలువలకు వ్యక్తులు ఏ విధంగా కూర్పును కలిగి ఉండాలో ఈ మాడ్యూల్ తెలుపుతుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: Integration of BPR, Lean, Six Sigma, and Design Thinking
content.description: Welcome to the "Integration of BPR, Lean, Six Sigma, and Design Thinking" module! We invite you to embark on a transformative journey where we delve into the seamless integration of BPR, Lean, Six Sigma, and Design Thinking. In an era of complex projects, cross-functional teams, and the need for strategic integration, this program equips you with the insights and skills needed to navigate the intricacies of process improvement effectively.

content.name: Design Thinking for Process Innovation
content.description: Welcome to the "Design Thinking for Process Innovation" module, where innovation meets intentionality. This module is designed to demystify Design Thinking, starting with its definition and fundamental principles. We'll explore the human-centered approach, emphasizing the crucial role of empathy in understanding user needs. Get ready to unleash your creative potential as we delve into techniques for ideation and rapid prototyping.

content.name: Public Policy Writing
content.description: Public policies play a crucial role in governance, impacting citizens' lives and shaping a nation's direction.  However, hastily crafted policies, often based on the perceptions of a select few, can result in unintended consequences and may fail to address the broader public perspective. This course on Policy Writing, spread across 10 short modules, introduces the techniques of sound policy writing, grounded in effective writing and communication principles, to ensure the success and effectiveness of public policies.

content.name: eGovernance Life Cycle
content.description: Get a holistic view of the eGovernance Life Cycle (eGLC), from ideation to implementation, and eventual disposal. Understand the stages involved in developing, deploying, and maintaining e-governance solutions. involved in developing, deploying, and maintaining e-governance solutions.
content.source: National E-Governance Division (NEGD) DeitY Govt. of India

content.name: Project Management
content.description: Learn the fundamentals of e-governance project management, covering initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure. Explore best practices, tools, and techniques to successfully deliver e-governance projects on time and within budget.
content.source: National E-Governance Division (NEGD) DeitY Govt. of India

content.name: Government Process Re-engineering
content.description: Explore the strategies behind Government Process Reengineering (GPR) and its role in streamlining public service delivery. Learn how to identify, analyze, and redesign government processes for efficiency and citizen-centric service delivery. processes for efficiency and citizen-centric service delivery.
content.source: National E-Governance Division (NEGD) DeitY Govt. of India

content.name: Change Management
content.description: Discover the importance of change management in e-governance initiatives. Discover the importance of change management in e-governance initiatives. Explore strategies to manage and guide organizational change, ensuring smooth transitions and stakeholder acceptance during digital transformation.
content.source: National E-Governance Division (NEGD) DeitY Govt. of India

content.name: సమాచార హక్కు చట్టం 2005
content.description: ప్రభుత్వోద్యోగిగా మీకు ఆర్‌టిఐ చట్టం గురించిన అవగాహన ఉండాలి. ఏదైనా ప్రశ్నకు స్పందించడానికి మీ సహకారం అవసరం కావచ్చు. ఈ చట్టంలోని సంబంధిత విభాగాలను, కరిమానాలతో సహా ఒక దరఖాస్తును నింపడం మరియు దానిని పరిష్కరించడం ఈ మాడ్యూల్ మీకు పరిచయం చేస్తుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: సమస్య పరిష్కారం మరియు నిర్ణయం తీసుకోవడం
content.description: మనందరం ఇంటివద్ద లేదా ఉద్యోగ ప్రదేశంలో ప్రతిరోజూ సమస్యలను పరిష్కరిస్తూనే ఉంటాము. సమస్య పరిష్కరణ నైపుణ్యం మనందరికీ ఉండాల్సిన ప్రధాన నైపుణ్యం. మీరు ఉద్యోగ ప్రదేశం వద్ద ఇబ్బందులు ఎదుర్కొంటున్నారా? అవును! మనందరమూ ఎదుర్కొంటున్నాము. ప్రతి ప్రభుత్వోద్యోగి, తన పని స్థలంలో సమస్యలను ఎలా ఎదుర్కొంటున్నారో మరియు వాటిని ఎలా పరిష్కరించవచ్చో ఈ మాడ్యూల్ మనకు వివరిస్తుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: ఒత్తిడి నిర్వహణ
content.description: అందరూ ఒత్తిడికి లోనవుతారా అని మీరు అనుకోవచ్చు. ఎక్కువ శాతం మంది ఒత్తిడికి లోనవుతారు – ఇంటి వద్ద మరియు ఉద్యోగ స్థలంలో రెండింటిలో! వ్యక్తిగత మరియు వృత్తిపరమైన జీవితంలో ఒత్తిడిని ఎలా నిర్వహించుకోవాలో సందర్భోచిత ఉదాహరణల ద్వారా ఈ మాడ్యూల్ వివరిస్తుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: వ్యక్తిగత మరియు వృత్తిపర ప్రభావశీలత
content.description: మనలో ఏ ఒక్కరూ అన్ని సమయాల్లో ప్రభావశీలకంగా ఉండలేరు. కొన్ని సమయాల్లో ప్రభావశీలకంగా ఉండని లక్షణాలను మనం కనబరుస్తాం. సవాళ్ళు ఎదురుగా ఉన్నప్పుడు, ముందుకు కొనసాగాలంటే మీ సామర్ధ్యాన్ని కొలవడానికి వ్యక్తిగత ప్రభావశీలత ఒక కొలమానం. మీ వ్యక్తిగత ప్రభావశీలకతను వృద్ధి చేసే పని యొక్క భిన్న అంశాలను ఈ మాడ్యూల్ తెలియజేస్తుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: లక్ష్యం నిర్దేశించుకోవడం
content.description: ఉదాహరణల ద్వారా SMARTER లక్ష్యాలను ఏర్పాటు చేసుకోవడం గురించి ఈ యూనిట్ వివరిస్తుంది. ఇది మూడు సాదృశ్యాలను కూడా అందిస్తుంది, వీటిలో మూడు వేర్వేరు బాధ్యతలలో ఉన్న ప్రభుత్వోద్యోగులు లక్ష్యాలను ఏర్పాటు చేసుకోవడానీ SMARTER పద్ధతిని ఎలా ఉపయోగించవచ్చో తెలియజేయబడుతుంది. చివరిగా, మీ బాధ్యతకు తగిన లక్ష్యాలను ఏర్పాటు చేసుకోవడానికి ఈ పాఠం చివర అందించిన SMARTER లక్ష్యాల పత్రము టెంప్లేట్‌ను డౌన్‌లోడ్ చేసి ఉపయోగించవచ్చు.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: విభేదాల పరిష్కారం మరియు రాజీపడడం
content.description: మన వ్యక్తిగత మరియు వృత్తిపరమైన జీవితాలలో వాదనలు మరియు వివాదాలు స్వాభావికంగా భాగమై ఉంటాయి. ఈ వివాదాలు లేదా వాదనలతో వ్యవహరించి ఒక శాంతియుతమైన పరిష్కారాన్ని తీసుకురావడం చాలా ముఖ్యము. వివాదాలను నిర్వహించుకుంటూ పరిష్కారాన్ని కనుగొనడంతో ఈ మాడ్యూల్ వ్యవహరిస్తుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: భావోద్వేగ మేధస్సు
content.description: ప్రతి వ్యక్తిలో భావోద్వేగాలు ముఖ్యమైన భాగంగా ఉంటాయి. మీ భావోద్వేగాలను నిర్వహించుకుంటూ భావోద్వేగ సూచికను వృద్ధి చేసుకోవడం ఎలాగో తెలుసుకోవడం ద్వారా మీ వ్యక్తిగత మరియు వృత్తిపరమైన జీవితంలో విజయం సాధించవచ్చు.  పౌరులతో వ్యవహరించేటప్పుడు మీ భావోద్వేగాఅలను అర్థం చేసుకోవడంలో ఈ మాడ్యూల్ సహాయపడుతుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: బృంద నిర్మాణం
content.description: వ్యక్తిగతంగా చురుకుగా ఉంటూ బలమైన మౌలిక సామర్ధ్యాలను కలిగి ఉండటం మంచిది. అయితే, మీరు బృందంలో పని చేయలేకపోతే లేదా ఒకరి సామర్ధ్యాలను మరొకరు ఉపయోగించుకోలేకపోతే, టీం ప్రదర్శన పేలవంగా లేదా సగటుకు పరిమితమై ఉంటుంది. ఈ మాడ్యూల్ టీం వర్క్ గురించి ప్రస్తావిస్తుంది, ఇది ప్రధానంగా సందర్భానుసార నాయకత్వం.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: ఫైనాన్స్ మరియు అకౌంట్స్
content.description: ఫైనాన్స్ అనేది కేవలం ఆదాయ వనరులకు మాత్రమే సంబంధించినది కాదు కానీ మనం నిధులను ఎలా ఉపయోగించుకుంటామో అనే దానికి సంబంధించినది కూడా. ఈ మాడ్యూల్ ఆర్ధిక పాలనను గురించి ప్రస్తావిస్తుంది, ఇది ఫైనాన్స్‌లోని అన్ని కోణాలను గురించి తెలుపుతుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: ప్రేరణ
content.description: ప్రోత్సాహమే ప్రదర్శనకు చోదక శక్తిగా పనిచేస్తుంది. ఇది ఒక వ్యక్తికి ఎంతో ముఖ్యమైనది. ప్రోత్సాహమే వ్యక్తులలో అంతర్లీనంగా ఉండే చోదక బలం మీ సందర్భం, పరిస్థితి మరియు ఉద్యోగానికి సంబంధించిన మీ ప్రోత్సాహాన్ని కనుగొనడంలో ఈ మాడ్యూల్ మీకు తోడ్పడుతుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: ప్రజా కేంద్రీకృత సంభాషణ
content.description: ప్రభుత్వోద్యోగులుగా, మన అనుదిన జీవితంలో మనం అనేక పౌరులతో కలుస్తుంటాము. మన భావప్రసారాలను పౌర-కేంద్రితంగా ఎలా ఉండాలో తెలుసుకోవడంలో ఈ మాడ్యూల్ సహాయపడుతుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: కార్యాలయ విధానాలు
content.description: ఏర్పాటు చేసిన సంస్థాగత లక్ష్యాలు లేదా ధ్యేయాలను సాధించడం కొరకు వ్యక్తులు కొన్ని చర్యలు చేపట్టే ప్రదేశమే కార్యాలయము. నిర్ణయాలు తీసుకోవడానికి సమాచారం ఎలా ప్రక్రియ చేయబడుతుంది మరియు సంస్థాగత లక్ష్యాలను లేదా ధ్యేయాలను ఎలా సాధిస్తుంది అనే అంశాలను ఈ మాడ్యూల్ వివరిస్తుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: నాయకత్వం
content.description: సీనియర్ స్థాయి అధికారులు లేదా ప్రభావం చూపగల వ్యక్తులలో మాత్రమే కాక అందరిలో నాయకత్వ లక్షణాలు ఉంటాయి, భిన్న పరిస్థితుల్లో ఎవరైనా వ్యక్తి ఎలా నాయకుడవ్వగలడు అనే విషయం ఈ మాఢ్యూల్‌లో ప్రస్తావించబడింది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: సమయ పాలన
content.description: ఉద్యోగులకు వారి ఉద్యోగ జీవితాన్ని సులభతరం మరియు సంతృప్తికరం చేసుకోవడానికి, సంస్థాగతమైన మరియు వ్యక్తిగతమైన విలువలకు మధ్య పొందిక ఉండేలా ఉద్యోగ స్థలం వద్ద ఒత్తిడిని తగ్గించుకోవడం ముఖ్యమైన సంగతి. సంస్థాగతమైన మరియు వ్యక్తిగతమైన విలువలకు వ్యక్తులు ఏ విధంగా కూర్పును కలిగి ఉండాలో ఈ మాడ్యూల్ తెలుపుతుంది.
content.source: Dr Marri Chenna Reddy Human Resource Development Institute of Telangana

content.name: Procurement Services (Consultancy / Non-Consultancy)
content.description: Describe the process of shortlisting in procurement of consultancy services, Explain the evaluation process of procurement of consultants and Explain the methods of procuring consultancy services and monitoring the contract.

content.name: Hazard Identification, Risk Assessment And Control (Hindi)

It encompasses techniques for crafting clear, organized technical documents, mastering scientific writing principles, conducting research, and ensuring proper citation. Students will develop proficiency in grammar and mechanics, and learn how to provide constructive feedback through peer review. Emphasis is placed on maintaining originality and applying these skills in real-world scenarios, preparing individuals for success in professional and academic writing environments.

Viewers gain an understanding of plagiarism as the unauthorized use of someone else's work and the importance of proper citation and attribution. The video also offers guidance on using quotations, paraphrasing, citing sources, and utilizing plagiarism detection tools. By following these tips, individuals can maintain academic integrity and avoid the pitfalls of plagiarism in their work.

content.name: E-Learning Modules on Basics of the Underwater World (Part-2)
content.description: In the second part of the course, the focus shifts towards advanced aspects of Underwater Domain Awareness (UDA) and its practical applications. The curriculum covers the Underwater Data Analytics Framework, providing insights into acoustic propagation in the Indian Ocean Region (IOR) and addressing underwater channel modeling, simulation, and field validation. Additionally, the course explores underwater robotics, including their challenges and opportunities, offering foundational knowledge, classification of applications, and insights into various types of Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (AUVs) and their design and development considerations. The discussion also extends to underwater deployment, emphasizing different deployment types, their applications, and the influence of tropical characteristics on sensor performance and safety. The course further addresses acoustic habitat degradation and management, highlighting underwater acoustics, sources of underwater noise, and marine spatial planning, with real-world examples such as Bubble Feeding by Big Whales. It concludes by examining the role of digital transformation in enhancing coastal communities' livelihoods. This encompasses the digital ocean, the development of an APY analysis tool for seaweed cultivation and shrimp farming, as well as the governance perspective and challenges associated with the APY Tool. These five segments provide advanced insights into UDA, from data analytics and underwater robotics to digital transformation, expanding participants' understanding of the multifaceted world of underwater domain awareness.

content.name: Science communication
content.description: This comprehensive course is designed for scientists, researchers, and educators who want to master science communication. Participants will learn to articulate complex scientific ideas compellingly, fostering public discourse and enhancing societal trust in science. Covering writing, visuals, and social media, the course focuses on educating and informing citizens for evidence-based decision-making. Beneficiaries of this course will gain a deep understanding of the science communication landscape, benefiting those eager to broaden the impact of their scientific and research work and engagement with the public.

content.name: E-Learning Modules on Basics of the Underwater World (Part-1)
content.description: This comprehensive course on Underwater Domain Awareness (UDA) covers a wide spectrum of topics vital to understanding UDA's role in contemporary maritime contexts. It begins with a foundational exploration of UDA, emphasizing its significance and key stakeholders. The course then delves into the strategic alignment of the UDA Framework with India's SAGAR vision, offering insights into India's global positioning and various projects that complement this vision. Next, it addresses the intricacies of UDA in tropical waters, considering political, economic, and historical challenges, while contextualizing UDA within the evolving Indo-Pacific strategy. The course also emphasizes sustainability concerns in the Indian Ocean, encompassing issues such as acoustic habitat degradation, IUU fishing, pollution, and ecosystem degradation, all within the context of India's unique tropical characteristics. Finally, it highlights the need for effective maritime governance and the imperative of a UDA framework. This section discusses regulatory challenges, decision-making dynamics, and the role of the scientific community in managing underwater domains. By encompassing these five modules, the course provides participants with a holistic and in-depth understanding of UDA's significance and its critical role in shaping maritime security and sustainability in the modern world.

Therefore, each kind of market failure is discussed in detail. In the end, a problem set is shared to solve that provides practical questions on public policy issues.

content.name: कौशल विकास और उद्यमशीलता मंत्रालय प्रारंभिक प्रशिक्षण
content.description:
यह ‘कौशल विकास और उद्यमशीलता मंत्रालय प्रारंभिक प्रशिक्षण’ मॉड्यूल एक डिजिटल इंटरैक्टिव ई-लर्निंग मॉड्यूल है, जो कौशल विकास और उद्यमिता मंत्रालय (एम.एस.डी.ई.), इसके प्रभागों और संगठनों का अवलोकन प्रदान करता है।

यह पाठ्यक्रम शिक्षार्थियों को कौशल विकास और उद्यमिता मंत्रालय (एम.एस.डी.ई.) और उसके संगठनों के अवलोकन, मिशन, विजन, प्रमुख भूमिकाओं और जिम्मेदारियों, संरचना और प्रमुख योजनाओं और परियोजनाओं को समझने और परिचित करने में मदद करेगा।

इसमें निम्नलिखित विषय शामिल होंगे : - 
• मंत्रालय का विज़न-मिशन और संरचना।
• मंत्रालय की प्रमुख भूमिकाएँ और जिम्मेदारियाँ।
• मंत्रालय की प्रमुख योजनाएं और नीतियां।
• मंत्रालय के डिजिटल पोर्टल और डैशबोर्ड।
• मंत्रालय के प्रमुख प्रभागों और उनकी जिम्मेदारियों का मानचित्रण।
• मंत्रालय के भीतर विभिन्न प्रभागों और संगठनों के प्रमुख अधिदेश, बुनियादी कामकाज, मुख्य प्रक्रिया, भूमिकाओं और जिम्मेदारियों के बारे में विस्तार से जानकारी।

यह समग्र प्रेरण मॉड्यूल शिक्षार्थियों को एक मूल्यांकन के माध्यम से उनकी समझ का आकलन करने में भी सक्षम करेगा।

content.name: Closed Circuit Television: The Vigilant Eyes of Delhi Metro
content.description:
This course is from Telecommunication Team of Delhi Metro Rail Academy of Delhi Metro. The course is developed to provide an overview of Closed Circuit Television (CCTV) Surveillance System installed inside Delhi Metro premises. 
The CCTV Network at DMRC is built for providing real time, visual surveillance through colour display of all public areas and other selected localities of stations throughout the Metro and rail corridors. At all the Stations, entraining and detraining at Platforms are secured by using Closed Circuit Television (CCTV) System. The CCTV Surveillance System is also installed for supervising strategic locations like AFC Gates, Ticketing Offices, Escalators and Platform operational area to ensure safe Operation of the Metro. The CCTV footage of each location is continuously monitored and recorded at various levels, thereby making the CCTV system infrastructure as the vigilant Eyes of Delhi Metro.

content.name: Application of Coir Geotextiles in Road Construction
content.description: This course offers comprehensive knowledge on the following topics: the utilization of Coir Geotextiles in Road Construction. Coir Geotextile (CGT) is created from coconut husk fibers known as coir. Compared to other natural fibers, coir fiber is exceptionally robust and degrades at a slower rate due to its high lignin content. Incorporating Coir Geotextile in road construction promotes the efficient use of local resources and the preservation of the environment. As a naturally occurring material, Coir Geotextile can reduce the amount of pavement construction materials required, resulting in cost savings. The desired outcome of the course is to familiarize relevant officers (such as AE, JE, AEE, and DPR consultants) with the practical implementation of Coir Geotextiles in rural road construction under PMGSY.

content.name: Geosynthetics in pavements.
content.description: This course provides detailed knowledge about following subjects, namely: Geosynthetics in pavements. Geosynthetics are man-made materials that are employed in combination with conventional pavement components such as soil, aggregates, and asphalt to enhance different aspects of pavement construction and performance. Geosynthetics used in pavements encompass several applications, including separation, reinforcement, filtration, drainage, reflective crack control, erosion control, and pavement overlay. This course offers comprehensive knowledge regarding the utilization of Geosynthetics in pavements. It covers various topics such as the types of Geosynthetics employed in pavements, manufacturing processes, functions of Geosynthetics, design methodologies, and diverse approaches to implementing Geosynthetics in pavements. The desired outcome of the course is to acquaint the relevant officers (such as AE, JE, AEE, EE, and DPR consultants) with the application of Geosynthetics in Pavements.

content.name: Audio Frequency Track Circuit
content.description:
This course of Audio Frequency Track Circuit (TI21M) is from Signalling and Train Control (S&TC) team of Delhi Metro Rail Academy of Delhi Metro. This course is developed for better understanding of train detection system used in metros/ railways system. There are two types of technologies generally used for train detection i.e. Track circuit and Axle counters. The track circuit continuously proves the presence of a train from a given section of track in a fail-safe manner. 
So, the aim of track circuit is to allow semi- automatic operation of railway/metro signalling system by displaying signals for train to slow down or stop in the presence of a train on a track circuit ahead of train, thereby preventing the train dispatchers and train operators from causing accidents.

content.name: Efficiency : Competency Framework
content.description: Efficiency in governance refers to the ability of a government or governing body to achieve desired outcomes and deliver services effectively while making the best use of available resources. It involves optimizing processes, minimizing waste, and maximizing productivity and effectiveness in the execution of government functions. Efficiency in citizen-centric governance holds great significance for various reasons. It ensures that government services are delivered promptly and effectively, meeting the needs of citizens and strengthening their trust in the government.

content.name: Waste plastic Modified Bituminous Mixes for Rural Roads
content.description: The "Waste plastic Modified Bituminous Mixes for Rural Roads" course is designed to provide participants with a comprehensive understanding of cold mix technology and its application in the construction and maintenance of rural roads. This course provides specialized training on utilizing waste plastic in modifying bituminous mixes for rural road construction using the dry process, aligning with PMGSY sustainability objectives. Several agencies including the National Rural Infrastructure Development Agency (NRIDA), have reported on the practice of using waste plastic in dry process in bituminous mixes, based partly or completely on the guidelines given in IRC: SP:98-2020. Similarly, the longer length of rural roads constructed with bituminous surface courses containing waste plastic in dry process is reported. It has been reported that the overall performance of pavements with bituminous layers containing waste plastic are better than the pavements constructed with conventional bituminous layers without waste plastic. This course is exclusively designed for engineers and professionals involved in rural road construction projects under the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY). It is specifically prepared to meet the needs of PMGSY engineers responsible for the planning, design, production, and construction of waste plastic modified bituminous mixes using the dry process.

content.name: Construction of Cement Stabilised Bases for Rural Roads
content.description: This course provides detailed knowledge about following subjects, namely: "Construction of Cement Stabilized Bases for Rural Roads". This course provides comprehensive training on the construction techniques and principle involved in creating cement stabilized bases for rural road infrastructure. The engineering properties of locally available soil materials/ marginal aggregates for rural road construction might not be suitable for design and construction according to the prevailing code of practices and hence it is necessary to explore the possibilities of using them with addition of stabilizer sand modifying the properties to meet the design requirements. Stabilization of the soils using cement to replace the conventional granular layers has become a common eco-friendly practice in many countries. The course focuses on imparting essential knowledge and practical skills to engineers, construction professionals, and individuals involved in rural road development projects. Participants will gain a deep understanding of the key concepts, methods, and best practices related to cement stabilization for road bases.

content.name: भारतीय डाक की पार्सल सेवाओं का सेगमेंटेशन, टार्गेटिंग और पोजीशनिंग
content.description:
पार्सल सेवाओं का सेगमेंटेशन रिटेल,बल्क ग्राहक, एयर ट्रांसमिटेड पार्सल सेवा, सरफेस ट्रांसमिटेड पार्सल सेवा, बीमा, कैश ऑन डिलीवरी,व्यवसाय से व्यवसाय (बी2बी),वयवसाय से ग्राहक (बी2सी), ग्राहक से ग्राहक (सी2सी) के आधार पर किया जा सकता है
इंडिया पोस्ट पार्सल सेवाओं के टारगेट ग्राहक शैक्षिक संस्थान, ई-कॉमर्स कंपनियां, केंद्र और राज्य सरकार, बैंकिंग बीमा और वित्तीय क्षेत्र, सरकारी ई-मार्केट, एमएसएमई, ओडीओपी, बीज और कृषि उपकरणों के पिक-अप और डिलीवरी, ट्राइफेड, केवीआईसी, और एग्रीगेटर्स हैं 
इंडिया पोस्ट रिटेल,बल्क और संविदात्मक ग्राहकों जैसे सभी प्रकार के ग्राहकों की आवश्यकताओं के अनुरूप पार्सल सेवाओं की सस्ती दरें प्रदान करता है।

content.name: Basics of Ecosystem based Disaster Risk Reduction
content.description: Over the past decade, disasters linked to natural hazards have exacted a significant toll on human lives, livelihoods, assets and economies. Nature-based Solutions (NbS) for Disaster Risk Reduction or more specifically Ecosystem-based Disaster Risk Reduction (Eco-DRR) is an approach where the regulatory functions of ecosystems (such as forests, wetlands and mangroves) are systematically harnessed to mitigate, prevent, or buffer against disasters. These solutions can provide disaster risk reduction services as well as offer other services of productive and cultural value, which also contribute to building communities, resilience to disasters and climate change impacts. Being cost effective, they are increasingly identified across the world as a no-regret investment which keeps nature at the core. This course aims to provide a basic understanding of what is meant by Ecosystem-based Disaster Risk Reduction and specifically its different applications in India.
content.source: Kerala Institute of Local Administration - KILA

content.name: Basics of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology
content.description: This e-Learning course of the Geological Survey of India Training Institute (GSITI) briefly introduces the learner to the world of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology. Scientifically, 'Nano' stands for those objects which are having at least one dimension between 1 nanometer to 100 nanometers. The nanometer is a factor of 10-9, which is 1 billionth of a meter. Nanoscience is a branch of science studying nano-scale particles and their manipulation. Nanotechnology involves the development of nano-scale materials and the application of their science in a fruitful way.

content.name: Cancellation and Revocation of GST Registration
content.description: This course provides an overview on Cancellation, Suspension and Revocation of Registration under GST Law. The registration granted under GST can be cancelled for specified reasons. The cancellation can either be initiated by the department at its own motion or the registered person can apply for cancellation of their registration. In case of death of registered person, in case of proprietorship concern, the legal heirs can apply for cancellation. During pendency of the proceedings relating to cancellation of registration, the registration may be suspended for such period and in such manner as may be prescribed. In case the registration has been cancelled by the department there is a provision for revocation of the cancellation at the request of the taxpayer. On cancellation of the registration the person has to file a return which is called the final return
content.source: National Academy of Customs, Indirect Taxes and Narcotics (NACIN)

content.name: Right to Information (RTI)
content.description:
Right to Information is derived from our fundamental right of freedom of speech and expression under Article 19 of the Constitution. Right to Information includes Right to inspection of work, documents, records. It also includes taking notes, extracts or certified copies of documents or records, taking information in any electronic mode or through print outs.
The Right to Information Act 2005 was promulgated in 2005 to promote transparency and accountability in the working of every public authority.

content.name: Engineering Properties of Rocks and Soil
content.description: This e-Learning course of the Geological Survey of India Training Institute (GSITI) briefly the Engineering Properties of Rocks and Soil. Engineering properties of rocks and soil is a collective nomenclature that includes all such properties of rocks and soil that are relevant to engineering applications after their extraction from natural beds or without extraction. The first set includes all those properties for which a rock must be tested for selection as a material for construction such as building stones, road stones, or aggregate for concrete making. The second set of properties includes the qualities of a natural bedrock and where it exists. That would determine its suitability or otherwise as a construction site for a proposed engineering project. Obviously, in both cases, the economy and safety of an engineering project are greatly dependent upon the proper understanding and determination of the engineering properties of rocks.

We will explore this course through nine critical areas:

Towards the end of the course, you will get an opportunity to test yourself on Blockchain and how best you can use it, through an assessment. content.name: ATAL BHUJAL YOJANA
content.description:
The government and policy makers have recognized the potential of community led groundwater management and the need to institutionalize such initiatives through convergence of Govt. initiatives with emphasis on demand side management and behavioural change for ensuring the long-term sustainability of ground water in the country. Atal Bhujal Yojana is a major step in this direction with an earmark of Rs.6, 000 crores to be implemented over a period of five years (2020-21 till 2024-25) for sustainable management of groundwater. This is the first scheme of its kind which will involve community based planning; monitoring; sharing and use of ground water data; capacity building of all stakeholders to demystify the complex science of ground water; community led groundwater management through a combination of demand side / supply side management measures. The program is being executed by the Ministry of Jal Shakti, and it is being financed by the Government of India and the World Bank on a proportion of 50:50 basis.

Objectives
	To demonstrate community-led sustainable ground water management which can be taken to scale. 
	To improve the management of groundwater resources in select water stressed areas in identified states viz. Gujarat, Haryana, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh.
	Sustainable ground water management, mainly through convergence among various on-going schemes with the active involvement of local communities and stakeholders. Ensuring judicious utilization of funds allocated by the Central and State governments for long term sustainability of ground water resources. 
	Creation of strong data base, scientific approach and community participation. 
	Strengthening the institutional framework for participatory groundwater management. 
	Bringing about behavioural change at the community level through awareness programs and capacity building for fostering sustainable groundwater management in the participating States.

content.name: Cold Mix Technology for Rural Roads
content.description: The "Cold Mix Technology for Rural Roads" course is designed to provide participants with a comprehensive understanding of cold mix technology and its application in the construction and maintenance of rural roads. Cold mix technology offers an innovative and cost-effective solution for road construction in remote areas where access to hot mix plants may be limited. The desired outcome of the course is to familiarize relevant officers (such as AE, JE, AEE, and DPR consultants) with the practical implementation of Coir Geotextiles in rural road construction under PMGSY. Upon completion of the course, participants will have a solid understanding of cold mix technology for rural roads, including its benefits, materials, mix design, construction techniques, quality control, and maintenance. They will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively implement cold mix technology in their respective road projects, leading to improved road quality, reduced costs, and enhanced sustainability.

content.name: Overview of Water Resources of India
content.description: India has diverse water resources, including rivers, lakes, groundwater, and reservoirs. The major rivers, such as the Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Indus, are crucial for irrigation, drinking water, and hydropower generation. Groundwater plays a significant role, especially in arid and semi-arid regions. However, over-exploitation and pollution have led to water scarcity in some areas. India has implemented various water management initiatives, including river interlinking projects and rainwater harvesting, to address water challenges and ensure sustainable utilization of resources. In order to highlight the water resources of India and the various initiatives taken to tackle the challenges, this course has been designed with 8 modules namely Rainfall of India, Rivers of India, Groundwater Resources of India, Contribution of Glaciers in Water Resources of India, Water Conservation Measures adopted in India, Water Management, Wetlands and Ramsar Sites in India and Inter-State Water Disputes.
content.source: North Eastern Regional Institute of Water and Land Management (NERIWALM)

content.name: Communication for Citizen Centricity
content.description: Communication is a process of giving, receiving, or exchanging information, opinions or idea so that the message is completely understood by everybody involved. It involves sending and receiving messages through the verbal and non-verbal methods. Communication is verbal, written and non-verbal. It helps us build relationships by allowing us to share our experiences and needs and help us connect to others. Listening, speaking, observing and empathising are the various communication skills.  For Government functionaries, good communication is considered an essential skill.

content.name: Emotional Intelligence
content.description: Emotional Intelligence is the ability to understand, use, and manage your own emotions in positive ways to relieve stress. It is also about how to communicate effectively, empathize with others, overcome challenges and defuse conflict. A high Emotional Quotient (EQ) helps you to build relationships, reduce team stress, defuse conflict and improve job satisfaction.

content.name: Urban Development in India: Basic Version
content.description: Urban development is associated with economic development. India while following a rapid pace of economic growth also moved forward on levels of urbanization. Successive census operations show that India achieved 31% share of urban population from a predominantly rural society in 1951 with only 17 % persons living in urban areas. However, the urbanization levels vary across the sates showing that high state GDP is associated with higher levels of Urbanisation. Tamil Nadu is the first state to become urban majority state in 2011whereas many other are also undergoing a similar transition such as Maharashtra, Gujarat etc. whereas many states like Bihar have around 10-20 percent share of urban population. At the same time, the urban centres face a mismatch in demand and supply of services, housing and infrastructure. Similarly, environment, mobility, climate change, poverty alleviation etc. are cross cutting theme across the cities and towns. In this context, urban administration needs suitable reorientation to make urban development sustainable, environment friendly, inclusive and productive.

content.name: ADMINISTRATIVE LAW
content.description: This course has been prepared/designed keeping in mind the confusion amongst Government employees about Administrative Law. Since Administrative Law is not a codified law, Govt. employees know very less about Administrative Law. This course will give basic ideas about Administrative Law and after successful completion of the course, you will be able to understand the Administrative Law, its origin & development, sources of Administrative Law, liabilities of State/Govt. and various functions of Administrative Authority. The next course on Administrative Law will contain Delegated Legislation, Constitutional Protection to Civil Servants, Public Service Commission and Natural Justice.

content.name: Time Management
content.description:
During the industrial revolution and the rise of factory work, people “had to learn to live by the clock rather than by the sun.”In 1911, Frederick Winslow Taylor published “The Principles of Scientific Management” in which he proposed the concept of time management.  Taylor was concerned with reducing process time and worked with factory managers on scientific time studies. 
At its most basic level, time studies involve breaking down each job into component parts, timing each element, and rearranging the parts into the most efficient method of working.
Managers and superiors play an important role in inculcating time management skills in employees and so must lead by example. The best way to finish work on time is to be punctual at workplace.
content.source: Department of Personnel and Training DoPT

content.name: Conflict Resolution and Negotiation
content.description: Conflicts are a natural part of our lives and can occur both at home and work. Conflicts at work are unavoidable due to different personalities and opinions among employees. Conflict Resolution Skills can be negotiation, mediation, arbitration, and adjudication.
content.source: Department of Personnel and Training DoPT

content.name: Motivation
content.description:
Motivation is a combination of motive and action. It is an action word and is fundamental in the level of success an individual attains. Finding ways to increase motivation is crucial because it allows us to change behaviour, develop competencies, be creative, set goals, and boost engagement.
Motivation can increase our efficiency and drive us to take action as we work towards our goal.
content.source: Department of Personnel and Training DoPT

content.name: Basics of Critical Information Infrastructure
content.description: There are infrastructure within a country, failure of which have the potential to disrupt economic activity of a nation, posing  threats to national security or loss of life etc..  Awareness about such critical infrastructure among government officials is very important as they are responsible for policy making, issuing guidance, allocating budgets, setting priorities etc. which are crucial for protection of such infrastructure assets.  In many cases, the government and PSU employees may be directly responsible for protection and continuous operation of such critical infrastructure. Since IT has become the backbone of managing such infrastructure, basic understanding of Critical Information Infrastructure among all employees is need of the hour.

content.name: Metallogeny with respect to Plate Tectonics
content.description: This e-Learning course of the Geological Survey of India Training Institute (GSITI) discusses in detail metallogeny with respect to plate tectonics. Metallogeny is a branch of Geology that deals with the study of the genesis of mineral deposits with emphasis on its relationship in space and time through regional petrologic and tectonic features of the earth's crust. Metallogeny is controlled by tectonics and magma types. The course has five transcribed lecture videos distributed in two modules.

content.name: Common Yoga Protocol- Punjabi
content.description: ਕਾਮਨ ਯੋਗਾ ਪ੍ਰੋਟੋਕੋਲ (ਸੀ. ਵਾਈ. ਪੀ.) ਯੋਗ ਅਭਿਆਸਾਂ ਦਾ ਇੱਕ ਸਮੂਹ ਹੈ ਜੋ ਆਯੁਰਵੇਦ ਮੰਤਰਾਲੇ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਵਿਕਸਤ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।ਯੋਗ ਅਤੇ ਕੁਦਰਤੀ ਇਲਾਜ, ਯੂਨਾਨੀ, ਸਿੱਧ ਅਤੇ ਹੋਮਿਓਪੈਥੀ (ਆਯੁਸ਼), ਭਾਰਤ ਸਰਕਾਰ।ਇਸ ਨੂੰ ਤਜਰਬੇ ਦੇ ਸਾਰੇ ਪੱਧਰਾਂ ਦੇ ਵਿਅਕਤੀਆਂ ਲਈ ਯੋਗ ਦੇ ਅਭਿਆਸ ਲਈ ਇੱਕ ਮਿਆਰ ਅਤੇ ਢਾਂਚਾਗਤ ਪ੍ਰਦਾਨ ਕਰਨ ਲਈ ਤਿਆਰ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

content.description: কমন ইয়োগা প্রোটোকল (CYP) হল যোগ অনুশীলনের একটি সেট যা আয়ুর্বেদ মন্ত্রক দ্বারা তৈরি করা হয়েছিল। যোগ ও প্রাকৃতিক চিকিৎসা, ইউনানি, সিদ্ধ এবং হোমিওপ্যাথি (আয়ুষ), ভারত সরকার। এটি সমস্ত স্তরের অভিজ্ঞতার ব্যক্তিদের জন্য যোগ অনুশীলনের জন্য একটি মানক এবং কাঠামোগত প্রদান করার জন্য ডিজাইন করা হয়েছিল।
content.source: Morarji Desai National Institute of Yoga (MDNIY)

content.name: Common Yoga Protocol- Assamese
content.description: কমন যোগ প্ৰট "কল (চি. ৱাই. পি.) হৈছে ভাৰত চৰকাৰৰ অন্তৰ্গত আয়ুৰ্বেদ, যোগ আৰু প্ৰাকৃতিক চিকিৎসা, ইউনানী, সিদ্ধ আৰু হোমিঅ’পেথী (আয়ুষ) মন্ত্ৰালয়ে প্ৰস্তুত কৰা যোগ পদ্ধতিৰ এক গোট। ইয়াক সকলো স্তৰৰ অভিজ্ঞতাৰ ব্যক্তিৰ বাবে যোগ অনুশীলনৰ ক্ষেত্ৰত এক মানদণ্ড আৰু গঠনমূলক শৈলী প্ৰদান কৰিবলৈ প্ৰস্তুত কৰা হৈছিল।

content.name: Common Yoga Protocol- Malayalam
content.description: ആയുർവേദ മന്ത്രാലയം വികസിപ്പിച്ചെടുത്ത ഒരു കൂട്ടം യോഗ പരിശീലനമാണ് കോമൺ യോഗ പ്രോട്ടോക്കോൾ (സിവൈപി). യോഗ & പ്രകൃതിചികിത്സ, യുനാനി, സിദ്ധ, ഹോമിയോപ്പതി (ആയുഷ്), ഇന്ത്യാ ഗവൺമെന്റ്. എല്ലാ തലത്തിലും അനുഭവപരിചയമുള്ള വ്യക്തികൾക്ക് യോഗാഭ്യാസത്തിന് ഒരു മാനദണ്ഡവും ഘടനയും നൽകുന്നതിനായാണ് ഇത് രൂപകൽപ്പന ചെയ്തിരിക്കുന്നത്.

content.name: Common Yoga Protocol - Tamil
content.description: பொதுவான யோகா நெறிமுறை (Common Yoga Protocol-CYP) என்பது இந்திய அரசின் ஆயுஷ் (ஆயுர்வேதம், யோகா மற்றும் இயற்கை மருத்துவம், யுனானி, சித்தா மற்றும் ஹோமியோபதி) அமைச்சகத்தால் உருவாக்கப்பட்ட யோகா பயிற்சிகளின் தொகுப்பாகும். அனைத்துத் துறைகள் மற்றும் அனுபவத்தில் உள்ள தனிநபர்களுக்கு யோகா பயிற்சிக்கான தரத்தையும் கட்டமைப்பையும் வழங்குவதற்காக இந்த நெறிமுறைகள் வடிவமைக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது.

content.name: Automatic Train Supervision System
content.description:
This course on Automatic Train Supervision System (ATS) is designed and developed by Signaling and Train Control (S&TC) team of Delhi Metro Rail Academy of Delhi Metro. 
This course is developed for providing an introduction to the centralized traffic management systems for metro trains around the world. 
Automatic Train Supervision System is a Traffic Management System which directs entire line train movement as per scheduling. Automatic Train Supervision System shall have Data Processing facilities that oversee and optimize the Train movements. It shall interface with other signalling Sub-systems such as Computer Based Interlocking, Automatic Train Control System, Master Clock, Passenger Information Display System, Public Address Systems, Train Radio.

content.name: Personal and Organizational Value
content.description:
Values are our beliefs we work and live with. Values determine our priorities and guide our behaviour. Everyone has values but each person has a different value set. This set is Personal values that are the guiding principles in our lives and inform our decision making, goal setting and overall disposition. They give us a better understanding of who we are. 
Organisational values are a set of core beliefs held by an organisation. These are guiding principles that provide an organisation with purpose and direction and set the tone for its interactions with its stakeholders, employees and others. Organisational values provide a common purpose that all employees should understand, work towards and live by.
content.source: Department of Personnel and Training DoPT

content.name: Team Building
content.description:
It is good to be individually brilliant and to have strong core competencies. However, if you cannot work in a team and harness each other’s core competencies, the team's performance will be poor or average.
Team building process is a step-by-step system for transforming a group of employees into an effective and collaborative unit. This is an ongoing process that helps a work group evolve into a cohesive unit. Team building refers to the type of activities, interactions and exercises used to strengthen the social connections within teams and organise employees into cooperative groups.
content.source: Department of Personnel and Training DoPT

content.name: Leadership
content.description:
Chhatrapati Shivaji, Maharana Pratap, Mangal Pandey, Rani Lakshmi Bai, Bhimrao Ambedkar, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, Mahatma Gandhi, …The list of revolutionary leaders is endless! One common factor that was special among all was their great vision and judicious use of resources at hand to solve problems.
Learning by their examples, leaders provide guidance, inspiration and motivation when achieving goals and rally people around a common cause. So, leadership is an attribute that gives direction and success to a cause, motivate and align people to goals.
content.source: Department of Personnel and Training DoPT

content.name: Automatic Train Protection System
content.description:
This course on Automatic Train Protection System (ATP) is designed and developed by Signaling and Train Control (S&TC) team of Delhi Metro Rail Academy of Delhi Metro. 
This course is developed for providing an introduction to the modern train control systems as used in metros around the world. 
Automatic Train Control system has two operational modes:  Automatic Train Protection mode & Automatic Train Operation mode. Automatic Train Protection system is primarily responsible for maintaining required gap between the trains running on the same route in same direction by controlling the target speeds, stopping and dwell time of trains on the platforms in real time scenario. It also authorizes the on board train management system to open the train doors on the correct (Platform) side, if the train is docked properly on the platform, besides managing other safety related on board operations

content.name: Conduct of Enquiry in Disciplinary Matters
content.description:
No major penalty can be imposed on an employee without conducting an Inquiry and giving a reasonable opportunity to the employee to defend herself. This video deals in detail the steps of conducting inquiry in disciplinary/ vigilance cases. The lecture is based on the the CCS(CCA) Rules 1965 which is applicable to most of the Central Government servants, yet the essential of Inquiry is the same irrespective of the
nature of the Government organization be it a Nationalized Bank, Government Corporation, Autonomous body etc.
content.source: Institute of Secretariat Training and Management

content.name: Problem Solving and Decision Making
content.description: A Problem is an indication that something did not work out quite as expected. Once this indication is clearly defined, possible solutions are generated and identified as to which solution is working and which is not. Then these alternative solutions are evaluated. After evaluation, decision on a solution is made. This solution is implemented and its outcomes are analysed. This is Problem Solving. The process of careful identification and evaluation of the alternative solutions is Decision Making.
content.source: Department of Personnel and Training DoPT

content.name: Cyber Security Basics
content.description: Nowadays, we’re inundated with reports of cyberattacks and their ramifications. We hear about attacks on global supply chains that have major economic consequences. Almost routinely, we find out that cybercriminals have stolen the personal information of millions of consumers through platforms used on a daily basis. Sometimes, we even hear about vital government and health services being blocked and extorted for ransom. Cyberattacks  continuously  evolve. Cybersecurity  is  an  important,  expanding field in  a  world  where  companies and institutions are racing to move and maintain their businesses online. Throughout this module, you'll get a foundational understanding of basic cybersecurity concepts.

content.name: Orientation Module on Mission LiFE
content.description:
LiFE - Lifestyle for Environment, is an India-led mass movement to “promote mindful and deliberate utilization, instead of mindless and destructive consumption”. Introduced at CoP26 in Glasgow and launched in October 2022 at Kevadia, Gujarat by Hon’ble Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, Mission LiFE aims to nudge individuals towards making simple behavioural changes in their lives and communities, to make them more environmentally sustainable.


A comprehensive and non-exhaustive list of 75 individual LiFE actions have been identified across 7 themes – Save Water, Save Energy, Reduce Waste, Reduce E-Waste, Say No to Single-Use Plastics, Adopt Sustainable Food Systems, And Adopt Healthy Lifestyles. These actions are specific, measurable, easy to practice, non-disruptive to ongoing economic activities and with minimal supply-side dependencies.
content.source: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change

content.name: Microsoft Teams
content.description:
Welcome to the COMPLETE GUIDE to Microsoft Teams! It's a step-by-step guide to Microsoft Teams for beginners. You'll learn how to use teams to collaborate, create channels, and manage chats, meetings, and files in one place.

Expected Outcomes:

·       Individuals will learn how to install and use MS Teams

·       Learning the different features of MS Teams and how they increase productivity in the workplace.

·       Learn how to communicate with the help of Teams.

·       Individuals will schedule a call, check the team's calendar, and also send their out-of-office messages

·       If you are not in your office or want to schedule a call with your team, understand how to look into their schedule before getting on a Teams call with them

·       Individuals can set up teams for specific project purposes and continue their conversation on those specific channels

·       Create a channel to focus more on the important task and function, and allocate the same to your team members.

·       Asking for approval instead of sending in an email and awaiting the same.

Welcome to the course that offers a beginner's guide to Microsoft Word. This course enables you to learn Word in simple and easy steps with a focus on making the learners understand and create tasks using Ribbon Menu, Rulers, Navigation Pane, Go to Command, Proof Reading, Views, edit pictures, Indenting, Track Changes, layout, and more.
Expected Outcomes:
•	Understand the importance of MS Word as a productivity skill
•	Different uses of Ribbon tabs and how they make work simpler
•	Rulers help the individual in controlling the margins of the document and the indentations of the paragraph. 
•	Navigation Pane helps the individual in navigating to a page or heading without scrolling the whole document.
•	Spelling and Grammar check helps the individual in correcting the document and proofreading it automatically.
•	Grouping helps in rotating, flipping, moving, resizing, multiple shapes and objects as they are single shapes and objects.
•	The individual can insert a picture, captions, icons, etc. for the beautification of the Word document.
•	The View tab of Microsoft Word helps in showing the document exactly how it will be viewed in different layouts
•	Using Microsoft Word's bookmarks, indenting, and bullets, users can create better reports.

content.name: Microsoft One Drive
content.description:
Welcome to the COMPLETE GUIDE to Microsoft One Drive! This course will help you understand the purpose of Microsoft OneDrive and will teach you how to use it. OneDrive can help you organize your files, give you constant access to your files on any device, and back up your files in case of theft or hard drive failure. You'll learn about Setting Up and Uploading Files and Folders, Creating Shared libraries, setting passwords, etc. This course will get you started using OneDrive.
Expected Outcomes:
•	Understand how to Store and sync files in the cloud and access them from anywhere on any device. Ideal for work in progress and sharing with specific individuals
•	Storing and syncing files in the cloud and accessing them from anywhere on any device. Ideal for work in progress and sharing with specific individuals
•	Share files and folders with a specific person or with the team. Also, check link settings and customize file/folder sharing
•	A shared library is a location to store files that are backed by a Team Site and are accessible within Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, or Outlook. And it’s easy to copy or move files where you and others need them
•	It is important to set a password for certain files and folders so that the information cannot be accessed by everyone
•	Users can delete folders or retrieve them. Also understanding the timeline by when the files get deleted.

content.name: Basics of Public Policy Research
content.description:
Public Administration is the study of the management, operation, and functioning
of government bodies and organizations in the public sector. As such, it is not
unique: other disciplines study this subject as well. Public Administration (PA)
distinguishes itself, though, by analysing the public sector from several angles in
an integrated manner. In other words, it is interdisciplinary in character,
employing knowledge from various disciplines in an integrated manner – or at
least it is a multidisciplinary form of research, which applies the insights from
different disciplines to one and the same subject.

Apart from its interdisciplinary approach, Public Administration research has
three other distinctive features. These unique features all influence the way in
which research is conducted.
Public organizations rely heavily on accurate data to make timely decisions regarding budgets, public policy, program implementation and general organization priorities. 
In order to accomplish these objectives, public administrators must quickly collect, analyze and interpret data.

content.name: Orientation on Faecal Sludge and Septage Management
content.description:
The course provides a comprehensive understanding of the various components of FSSM to implement effective and sustainable sanitation solutions in cities through hands-on experience. With the increasing importance and need in small and medium towns, it is necessary to strengthen the existing knowledge base and build capacity for its planning and implementation.
The course is designed to enable participants to plan for the entire sanitation service chain, through various national missions namely, SBM-U 2.0, AMRUT 2.0 and the recommendations of the 15th Finance Commission, thereby achieving targets of SDG 6.2 and 6.3.
Since WASH is one of the crucial sectors under SCM, the course is crucial for officials from Smart Cities to plan for city wide inclusive sanitation services.
content.source: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

content.name: Artificial Source Geophysical  Exploration Methods
content.description:
Geophysical Exploration by artificial Source Geophysical Methods are carried  out generally look for concentrations of anomalously high values of the physical property being measured. The interpreted results of the survey are used to identify a target of interest, or to correlate the spatial variation of values of the property with variations in the geology. Thus the primary reasons to do geophysical surveys are to get information on geology, and possibly to find targets
of economic interest.

content.name: Butterfly Diversity and Identification
content.description: Butterflies are vivid expressions of life and since time immemorial have inspired writers, poets, artists and naturalists throughout the globe. “Rabindranath Tagore once wrote- The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough”. “The fluttering of a butterfly's wings can effect climate changes on the other side of the planet” by Paul Erlich, is a more recent quote. India has extremely diverse terrain, climate and vegetation, which comprises extremes of heat cold, desert and jungles, of low-lying plains and the highest mountains, of dryness and dampness, islands and continental areas, widely varying flora, and sharply marked seasons.  In addition, India hosts three of the world's biodiversity hotspots: the Western Ghats, the Eastern Himalayas, and the hilly ranges bordering India and Myanmar, each having numerous endemic species. Accordingly, India's diverse and varied fauna include a rich variety of butterflies.  In 1932, Brigadier William Harry Evans recorded approximately 1439 species of butterfly from British India, and now ~1700 taxa of butterflies are known  from India.  Butterflies are also ecologically important because of the role they play in the food chain of a forest ecosystem. Their egg, larva (caterpillars) and adult (butterfly) form the food of a number of other animals. Most butterflies are pollinators of flowering plants and have a symbiotic relationship with plant diversity as they are dependent upon a variety of plants for larval food. Butterflies are also good biological indicators of environmental variation and quality. Ecotourism with butterflies in parks, gardens and  conservatories has recently gained much importance and widely practiced in many countries across the tropics. Keeping all these aspects in mind it has now become important for us to know about and identify butterflies in our neighborhood. This course  is designed for beginners to make them aware about various aspects of butterflies and guide them in identification
content.source: Indian Council of Forestry Research and Education

content.name: Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana  (SAGY)
content.description:
Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (SAGY), as a path breaking initiative in rural development was launched by the Hon’ble Prime Minister on 11 October 2014 with the objective of creating Adarsh Grams (Ideal Villages) across the country. The scheme Guidelines called upon the Hon’ble Members of Parliament to make one Gram Panchayat of their choice a Model Village by 2016, and another two by 2019 and thereafter every year one Gram Panchyat each year till 2024. The Hon’ble MPs have adopted in the first phase of SAGY (2014-2019) total 1510 Gram Panchayats and in the second phase of SAGY (2020-2024) which is ongoing 541 Gram Panchayats have been identified till now. These ‘Adarsh Grams’ are to serve as ‘nucleus of health, cleanliness, greenery and cordiality’ within the village community becoming schools of local development and governance, inspiring neighbouring Gram Panchayats.

The Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (SAGY) converges resources available from a range of existing Central Sector, Centrally Sponsored and State Schemes to achieve the programme objectives and as such, no additional funding is deemed necessary.

The Gram Panchayats under the guidance of Hon’ble MPs follow a structured process of environment-creation, social-mobilisation, resource-mapping and participatory development planning
content.source: NIRDPR National Institute of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj

content.name: DEVELOPMENT CHALLENGES IN TRIBAL AREAS AND ASPIRATIONAL DISTRICTS
content.description:
Several debates in the post-independence period with regard to the administration and welfare of tribal community led to two major approaches to tribal society. On the one hand, GS Ghurye advocated the principle of assimilation whereby he held that tribal societies were in fact, Hindus who should be assimilated into the Hindu mainstream fold. On the other hand, Verrier Elwin argued that tribal societies had their unique traditions and customs which needed to be preserved. As a result, the present approach of the state has been to preserve the traditions and customs of the trial communities but at the same time prevent their isolation by introducing policies and schemes for their socio-economic development.
This course is designed to understand Racial, Cultural and Economic Classification of Tribes in India and their challenges, Development and Deprivation. The Constitution of India does not define ‘Scheduled Tribes’ as such. However, Article 366 (25) refers to Scheduled Tribes as those communities who are scheduled in accordance with Article 342 of the Constitution. According to Article 342 of the Constitution, the Scheduled Tribes are the tribes or tribal communities, or part of or groups within these tribes and tribal communities, which have been declared as such by the President through a public notification or through a subsequent amending Act of Parliament.
Adivasis is the collective name used for the many indigenous peoples of India. Adivasis often face hardships and exclusion because of physical remoteness, poverty and prevalent social prejudices. Their natural habitats, resources, customs, rituals and traditions are facing a danger of extinct. For their betterment and upliftment, Indian government started many projects and developmental programmes.
Several developmental schemes including Tribal Sub-Plan (TSP) were framed and implemented by the Central as well as State Governments and other agencies. These efforts indicate possibilities of substantial change.

content.name: Public Finance under Co-operative Federalism
content.description:
This course is designed to augment behavioural competency among the participants. It aims towards civil services capacity building by standardising and harmonising the shared understanding of co-operative federalism. It expounds on federal architectures that exist in the world and India in particular. It would enable them in narrowing down the inconsistencies in training priorities, competencies, and pedagogy.

Participants would gain conceptual clarity and comprehensive knowledge about federations. The module answers 4 W’s- What (concept), Why (importance), When (evolution), Where (federations in the world), and How (functions, roles, activities, and competencies of different federal units). Learners would also get exposure to the intricate relationship between Indian diversity and federal structure. Thus it would help them in being respectful and sensitive to citizens while performing citizen-centric service delivery. Hence, after completing the module, participants are expected to be proactive and polite in delivering citizen-centric services, silo-less performance, and leveraging the democratised civil services.

content.name: Basics of e-Governance & Digital India
content.description: This module explains basic constructs of e-governance – the strategy of employing digital technologies in accelerating the processes of governance and the related concepts associated with it. It also describes in an easy-to-understand manner the flagship Digital India program of the Government of India.

content.name: Agriculture and Rural Development
content.description:
Agriculture is the life blood of India’s economy and the sector cuts across all socio-economic backdrops. Ensuring food security to ever increasing population of India by increasing agriculture output has been the cornerstone for development of the agriculture sector in the country since mid-1960s. Prior to this, the foodgrains in the country were made available mainly through imports of wheat as food aid from the USA. Empirics show that heavy dependence on key food imports make the importing country vulnerable and this underscores the importance of food security. The results of innovations in term of "Green Revolution" were remarkable. This strategy to become self-reliant on food front has been successful in the sense that India moved from import-dependence to self-sufficiency and then to a net food exporting country. However, the strategy did not explicitly promote farmers’ welfare with the result that their income remained low. The disparities in income levels in agriculture and non-agriculture sectors have been huge. Rising production of food grains without concomitant increase in the income level of farmers is a paradox of sorts. 
This Basic Stream ‘Sustainable Agriculture and Risk management’ seeks to cover a bouquet of 10 modules, starting from an aerial view of Agriculture to WTO, sustainability concerns and Doubling of Farmers’ Income, just to name a few. It seeks to discuss as to how can India reorient her agriculture and approach the sector from the perspective of its primary actors namely the farmers and how Indian Agrarian societies can find renewed global predominance, as the world faces growing populations and industrial demands.

content.name: Service Delivery Management
content.description: This Course has been designed to promote critical thinking to know the nuances of service delivery management in order to improve decision making and help in prompt and effective delivery of services. It gives an opportunity to the participants to reflect and analyse decisions made in a situation of crisis in order to promote good governance and enhance public trust and thereby deepen democratic values.

content.name: NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT
content.description: Natural resource management focuses on the need of sustainable management of the Earth's depleting natural resources such as clean water, energy, minerals and biological resources, in relation to the growth of the human population. To answer these pressing issues, professionals need to be able to work in interdisciplinary teams and apply scientific, ecological, economic and social knowledge to come up with holistic solutions.

content.name: Social Policy and Migration
content.description: The 2030 Agenda of SDGs recognizes for the first time the contribution of migration to sustainable development. By adopting the 2030 Agenda, Member States have committed to leave no one behind in their implementation of the SDGs. Labour Migration in India is increasingly a key livelihood strategy for households across the country. An important voice in the debate on ‘circular migration’ has been that of Jan Breman, a sociologist who advocated a concept ‘foot loose labour’. This course proved a critical appraisal on labour migration and governance in India. The course is an attempt to deliberate on migration: Concepts and leading theories; Internal Labour Migration in India; Governance of Labour Migration; Evidence-based Policies on Migration and Development; Employment and Migration; Migration and Health; Migration and Gender; Displacement and Migration; Migration, Poverty and Inequalities; Migrant Workers and Human Rights; Migration and Remittances; and Migration and social Policies.

content.name: STRESS MANAGEMENT
content.description:
With the growing competition, jobs have become more demanding. Employers want success and their single line advice to their employees is “Perform or Perish”. To achieve the desired goals employees are working as if they are human robots with a single mission to succeed. People are working at a frantic pace without caring for their health, eating junk food, staying away or communicating to a minimum level with their near and dear ones resulting in physical and mental stress. Stress indeed has become a major concern of modern times. It not only affects an individual physically and mentally but also affects his performance at work. Infact, stress is like
slow poison which cuts our lifespan, erodes our health and corrodes our mind. People have their own methods for managing stress. In some people, stress-induced adverse feelings and anxieties tend to persist and intensify. Learning to understand and master stress management techniques can help prevent the counter effects of this urban malaise.

content.name: Public Privare Partnerships (PPP) for Infrastructure Projects
content.description:
This course of ‘Public-Private Partnership (PPP) for Infrastructure Projects’ will assist in understanding what is Infrastructure, how much finance is required for the development and management of infrastructure, and what are financing options available and being opted. Public-Private Partnership, as an approach has been adopted for infrastructure development and management, internationally and nationally. This basic course covers the reasons for opting PPP by various National Governments across the world, how PPP definition has evolved? what is the structure of PPP, its framework, and its process? The course concludes by sharing national and international websites on PPP.
This online course on PPP for Infrastructure Projects comprises of three modules :
(i)	Infrastructure an introduction
(ii)	Infrastructure financing
(iii)	PPP for infrastructure projects
Each module has well-defined objectives and learning from the module. Elements of Watch, Think, Do, Explore and Test are inbuilt in each module. An assessment to assess the level of one’s learning from the course is available at the end of the course. 
Intended Audience: This course is designed for officers who have the interest to recap their knowledge on infrastructure or eager to learn about infrastructure, to know how funds and latest technical know-how is organized for development and management of Infrastructure by different levels of Governments, which now, are playing the role of a facilitator instead of their earlier role of providers.

content.name: Project Management
content.description: The course on 'Project Management' aims at achieving defined goals by using plans, schedules, and resources to execute key activities within a set timeframe. Capital-intensive schemes in all major Ministries and Departments seek to place a substantial focus on input-related risk factors, particularly the acquisition, exploration, and subsequent operation and maintenance part of the schemes. The decision to continue a scheme or to increase its bandwidth through new investments are the primary challenges even after receiving the consultancy services. The project implementing unit of the Department/Ministry is supposed to have more accurate information about the scheme’s performance. Mostly, despite having information, accurate analysis-based decisions are barely taken. The precise analysis can be done by employing suitable socio-economic techniques and tools. The skills pertaining to project analysis would enable the managers to take concrete decisions about projects' probability and loss. The identification of key bottlenecks and challenges would not only enable departments to take a balanced decision but also empower them to have a smooth handle on key issues relevant in decision making.
